ygData.subject: The Battle
ygData.msgSnippet: (hey! no one responded to the shots fired by the Element!:( ) Different shots heading for the electors hit the shields of the Element, all being destroyed.

(hey! no one responded to the shots fired by the Element!:( )

Different shots heading for the electors hit the shields of the Element, all 
being destroyed. Looking around the battle, Mantle saw the other Maximals 
fighting. From the look of their base, things weren't good. He looked down 
at his team, sending a message to their minds:

"You guys go ahead, I'll battle from here." He looks up in time to see a big 
robot reaching for something that looked like a bunch of metal. His mind 
probed out, seeing that it was a robot. Mantle was a bit surprised at all 
the rage that he could feel around him, as well as the pain and suffering, 
but he was used to it by now. On his first several battles it surprised him, 
though, and made him a bit less good of a leader untill he got used to it. 
But he was used to it now, and no one was going to push the Maximals around 
while he was on this planet!

Mantle concentrated hard, making his mind reach out across the battlefield. 
He flexed his mind and Firearm's body rose from the shields, avoiding 
Menasor's grab. Mantle slowly lowered to the ground, his teeth clenched. One 
of the setbacks of his ability to use his mind to directly influence robots 
was that it created a temporary link between those robots and himself. In 
this case, Mantle could feel the pain that Firearm was feeling, and it was 
almost too much. But he held on, flipping Firearm through the air with his 
mind. Sweat poured down his forehead as he made Firearm's body quickly fly 
through the air toward the Element.

Through nearly closed eyes, Mantle could see the rest of his team emerging 
from the shield, still firing. He saw that Cinder was looking through the 
battle, searching for the bot she had been worrying about as she fired more 
at Deamon Wulf. His eyes drifted to the rest of his family, seeing Rocky 
fire two more missiles at Dark Claw. Aqua nearly tripped over the uneven 
ground, causing one of his spears to dig into the earth, but the next three 
were aimed exactly at Flesh Ripper's head. Above him, Mist gained altitude, 
firing charges at Menasor's hand.
